alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 6:21AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tanana River from Delta Junction to Fairbanks * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...The Tanana River has risen to bankfull and is going overbank and causing minor flooding in some low lying areas. Residents in flood prone areas adjacent to the Tanana River may have water inundate portions of their yards. Minor flooding is also possible at the boat landing at Whitestone Farms near Delta Junction and the Perkins Landing area near Fairbanks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 616 AM AKDT, heavy rain that fell over the South Slopes of the Alaska Range from Denali to Isabel Pass the past several days has caused high water to flow down the Delta River and other rivers draining the Alaska Range. This has caused the Tanana River to rise to bankfull and overbank in some locations. Another round of heavy rain is expected over the same area today through Wednesday. - For Tanana River at Big Delta: At 5:15am Tue the stage was 22.27 feet. Flood Stage is 23.0 feet. Forecast crest around 23.5 feet is expected around 4:00am Thursday. For Tanana River at Fairbanks: At 5:15am Tue the stage was 25.03 feet. Flood Stage is 24.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 25.1 feet is expected around 10:00am Thursday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Tanana River from Delta Junction to Fairbanks, you are encouraged to monitor water levels.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley
